name: inoperative
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
(of a law, rule, etc.) not having effect or power, or (of a machine, system, etc.) not working or not able to work as usual: The old regulations became inoperative when the new ones were issued. There were guidelines about the procedure to follow if any of the voting machines became inoperative. Opposites
functional
operative formal
running (happening regularly)
working

Machines - not functioning
act up
balky

malfunction

short circuit
shot
shudder
shut
shut (something) down
shut (something) off
shutdown
See more results »
Add to word list
Add to word list
LAW if a law or rule is inoperative, it does not have any effect and cannot be used: Legislation to repeal inoperative provisions in the tax law was approved.
if a machine, system, etc. is inoperative, it does not work as it should and cannot be used: make/render sth inoperative The virus infects your PC and renders the whole operating system inoperative.
